title: Sam Burgess posts cute pics in Bowral moments before clash with father-in-law that led to AVO
text:
Smiling under the sun with his two young children, Sam Burgess looked a picture of happiness as he visited estranged wife Phoebe's family home in Bowral on Saturday.

The NRL star, 30, uploaded a series of snaps with two-year-old Poppy and 10-month-old Billy to Instagram with the emotional caption: 'My two little everythings'.

But just hours after taking the happy photos, police were called to the Southern Highlands property by Phoebe's father Mitchell Hooke.

It is alleged an argument took place between Burgess and Mr Hooke, and Burgess was asked to leave the property, which he did.

Police visited the Hooke property afterwards to investigate the alleged incident, and took out an Apprehended Violence Order against Burgess on behalf of Mr Hooke.

Smiling under the sun with his two young children, Sam Burgess looked a picture of happiness as he visited his wife's family home in Bowral on Saturday

Burgess (right) was visiting his children at his father-in-law Mitchell Hooke's (left) home in Bowral on Saturday when the two men pair allegedly argued

Phoebe was not there at the home (pictured) for the visit after separating with Burgess for the second time just weeks ago

A NSW Police spokeswoman told Daily Mail Australia 'police are investigating an incident at a property near Bowral shortly before 5pm on Saturday.'

'There are no reports of any injuries.'

Burgess is due before Moss Vale Local Court on November 6. It is also not alleged he did anything wrong by visiting the home.

Phoebe was not there for the visit after separating with Burgess for the second time just weeks ago.

It comes amid rumours Burgess is set to retire due to a chronic shoulder injury.

Burgess, from west Yorkshire, England, is one of the NRL's biggest and most marketable stars and last year signed a three-year-contract for $1.2million a year.

In round five in April he sustained a shoulder injury against the New Zealand Warriors which plagued him for the rest of the season.

Rumours are swirling that he may never play again - but the Souths are still hoping he may come through.

Sam Burgess is pictured with his wife Phoebe and his parents in law in an Instagram snap

Police have taken out a temporary apprehended violence order out on NRL star Sam Burgess on behalf of the father of his estranged wife Phoebe

Last week Phoebe posted a family photo of her own with the caption: 'Even when I hide in the storage room for a minute of peace... they find me'

In April, Phoebe confirmed that she and Burgess had reconciled after their initial split, but admitted things weren't 'perfect'. Pictured: The mother with her children

Meanwhile, Phoebe's friends say she is planning to relocate to Bowral in the wake of the split to be closer to her family and support network.

'One thing is for sure, it is definitely over this time and they are now trying to figure out how to co-parent long-term,' a source told The Daily Telegraph.

Burgess and Phoebe rekindled their relationship in April after initially splitting last December, but an insider claimed things 'just didn't work' and Sam 'moved out several weeks ago'.

The source added: 'The most important thing for them is that their children are happy and healthy, that is their priority.'

Last week Phoebe posted a family photo of her alone with her children with the caption: 'Even when I hide in the storage room for a minute of peace... they find me'

During their brief separation earlier this year, Burgess moved into Anthony Bell's $11.5 million Dover Heights mansion, The Sydney Morning Herald reported.

In April, Phoebe confirmed to Stellar magazine that she and Burgess had reconciled after their initial split, but admitted things weren't 'perfect'.

'Every person on this planet who is married knows it isn't perfect. It's never going to be perfect... Sam and I will have good days and we'll have trying days,' she said at the time.

Phoebe added that the reason for their split, and the details of their reconciliation, 'will always and forever just be between Sam and I'.
